name: javascript
description: A versatile language for building dynamic web applications.

name: python
description: A powerful language known for its simplicity and readability.

name: react
description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

name: node.js
description: A runtime environment for executing JavaScript on the server side.

name: css
description: A style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document.

name: html
description: The standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.

name: web development
description: The work involved in developing a website for the Internet.

name: frontend
description: The part of a website that users interact with directly.

name: backend
description: The server side of an application and everything that communicates between the database and the browser.

name: apis
description: A set of definitions and protocols for building and integrating application software.

name: databases
description: Organized collections of data, generally stored and accessed electronically from a computer system.

name: devops
description: A set of practices that combines software development and IT operations.

name: machine learning
description: A method of data analysis that automates analytical model building.

name: ai
description: The simulation of human intelligence in machines.

name: security
description: The practice of protecting systems, networks, and programs from digital attacks.

name: cloud computing
description: The delivery of computing services over the internet.

name: mobile development
description: The process of creating software for mobile devices.

name: testing
description: The process of evaluating and verifying that a software product or application does what it is supposed to do.

name: typescript
description: A strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript.

name: ruby
description: A dynamic, open-source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity.

name: php
description: A popular general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited to web development.

name: java
description: A high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language.

name: c++
description: A general-purpose programming language created as an extension of the C programming language.

name: c#
description: A modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft.

name: kubernetes
description: An open-source system for automating the deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

name: docker
description: A set of platform-as-a-service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.

name: graphql
description: An open-source data query and manipulation language for APIs, and a runtime for fulfilling queries with existing data.

name: svelte
description: A radical new approach to building user interfaces.

name: swift
description: A powerful and intuitive programming language for macOS, iOS, watchOS, and tvOS.

name: go
description: An open-source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

name: rust
description: A language empowering everyone to build reliable and efficient software.

name: ci/cd
description: A method to frequently deliver apps to customers by introducing automation into the stages of app development.

name: agile
description: A methodology for iterative and incremental development.

name: scrum
description: A framework within which people can address complex adaptive problems.

name: version control
description: A system that records changes to a file or set of files over time so that you can recall specific versions later.

name: blockchain
description: A system of recording information in a way that makes it difficult or impossible to change, hack, or cheat the system.

name: algorithms
description: A process or set of rules to be followed in calculations or other problem-solving operations.

name: data structures
description: A particular way of organizing and storing data in a computer so that it can be accessed and modified efficiently.

name: big data
description: Large, complex data sets that require advanced systems for processing and analysis.

name: iot
description: A system of interrelated computing devices, mechanical and digital machines, objects, animals, or people.

name: ar/vr
description: Technologies that blend the digital and physical worlds.

name: quantum computing
description: Computing using quantum-mechanical phenomena, such as superposition and entanglement.

name: cybersecurity
description: The practice of protecting systems, networks, and programs from digital attacks.

name: robotics
description: The branch of technology that deals with the design, construction, operation, and application of robots.

name: serverless
description: A cloud-computing execution model in which the cloud provider runs the server, and dynamically manages the allocation of machine resources.
